key_channel_insights.line_content: Over 86% of fares matched the official site, with minimal lower pricing found.
70–80% of fares were cheaper, while no scenarios were more expensive than the official site.
Around 96% of fares were priced above the official site, reflecting a consistent premium.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 86% of OTA tickets matched website prices, indicating broad consistency.
Fewer than 2% of itineraries were cheaper on OTA, suggesting low undercutting.
About 4% were missing, showing minimal distribution gaps.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA N/A was 4% overall; changes were marginal.
Around 86.85% at parity, an uptick from last month.
8% of OTA fares were priced above official site, with no drastic short-term shifts.
OTA under 2% priced below the official site, showing minimal discounting.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 78% at parity; OTA Higher reached 15%, notably higher than the 1% on long-haul.
95% matched the site; OTA Higher negligible, reflecting stable alignment.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 94% exact matches, 0% OTA Higher, demonstrating home market parity.
OTA Higher at nearly 15%, highlighting greater variance.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 86% at parity; OTA Higher ~7%, slightly down from last month.
88% matched the site; OTA Higher ~8.5% with minor weekly fluctuations.

mse_highlights.line_content: 70–80% of fares cheaper than the official site, indicating consistent price advantage.
Average difference last week was -0.04%, slightly below the official fare.
No observed scenarios with higher prices, reinforcing downward channel pressure.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Remains minimal at 0.0% last week and ~0.6% over the month.
One-quarter of itineraries match official site, demonstrating limited parity.
71% last week and 70% over the month, confirming predominant lower pricing.
No recorded instances above the official site.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 80% of short-haul fares cheaper on MSE, showing minimal fluctuation.
60% of fares are lower, 40% same as website.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Around half match official site, just over half cheaper on MSE.
Nearly 90% cheaper, highlighting stronger advantage outside SG.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 75% cheaper, reinforcing short-notice cost savings on MSE.
64% cheaper, confirming MSE's competitive edge in advanced bookings.

gds_highlights.line_content: 96% priced above the official fare, with small weekly variations.
GDS-lower remains negligible but slightly higher in close-in windows.
Below 5% parity, stable from week to week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No material cases of unavailability for GDS.
Around 5% parity in certain segments, stable over time.
Remains <1% but saw slight uptick from last month in certain segments.
94–98% of fares show a premium, illustrating an entrenched higher channel.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 95% GDS-higher in the latest week; minimal GDS-lower.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 94% GDS-higher; GDS-lower observed only in older data.
98% GDS-higher, near-zero lower fares, maintaining a premium.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 94% higher, ~5% same; GDS-lower reached 1.9% last month, an uptick from earlier periods.
